div.pre: 2138 Sicily, 1879 (971) Burial: 350-25 B.C. (K) Contents: 52 AE Adranum: 15 litrae (Apollo/lyre, 8 restruck on Syracuse) Syracuse: 3 litrae (Athena/dolphins and star) Unc.: 3 attributed Alaesa (KAINON, horse/griffin) 31 (*Zeus/eagle) * BMC, Locri nos. 20-3, but perhaps a Sicilian mint is to be preferred Disposition: Rollin and Feuardent, Paris Head, NC 1879, pp. 217-8
